title: Windows 11 ja Firefox sekä Mozilla
content: Hei Mozilla Hankin uuden tiekoneen missä on Windows 11. Mozilla toimi aluksi ongelmitta ensisijaisena selaimena. Ensimmäisten W11 päivitysten jälkeen W11 palomuuri ei suostu enää päästämään Mozillaa nettiin. Saapuva ja lähtevä liikenne estetty. Firefoxin lisääminen sallittujen sovellusten joukkoon ei auta. Kirjoitan tätä vanhalla tietokoneella missä Windows 10 ja kaikki toimii kuten ennenkin. Ellen pysty tai ellette pysty ratkaisemaan ongelmaa on pakko vaihtaa selainta? Ystävällisin terveisin Pasi
creator: pasi.salmikallio

title: Troubleshoot Mode doesn't fix problem, but new profile does? (website comments not loading under articles at 9to5Mac)
content:
In Firefox, the comments section on articles at 9to5Mac have not loaded for me for some time. Today I was trying to figure out why.

Troubleshoot Mode did not fix it. (In Troubleshoot Mode, if I carefully watch the webpage loading, for a moment I see a flicker of the comments section loading for a fraction of second, but then it disappears.)

Example screenshots of this:

https://imgur.com/a/fQ18i2G


But creating a new profile in Firefox does fix it.

A few examples of the many webpages where this occurs:

  • https://9to5mac.com/2022/12/12/microsoft-authenticator-apple-watch-discontinued/#comments
  • https://9to5mac.com/2022/12/12/xiaomi-clone-the-iphone-shocking/#comments
  • https://9to5mac.com/2022/11/16/kuo-iphone-15-pro-with-usb-c-to-offer-major-boost-in-data-transfer-speeds/#comments

The comments section also loads properly when looking at these same webpages in Chrome and Microsoft Edge.

I think(?) this behavior also happens with some other websites' comment sections, although I don't usually pay much attention to comment sections.

Any thoughts on how to fix it without needing rebuild my entire profile brick by brick?

Basic information: Firefox 107.0.1 (64-bit) (latest update available), Windows 10, i7 11th generation, 16 GB RAM

Thank you!
creator: jsino

title: Firefox opening way too slow
content: For the past 2 days, Firefox is ridiculously slow in opening; 45 minutes yesterday, 25 minutes today. What is going on? How do I fix this? If it continues for another day or two, I'm switching to Chrome, because I can't put-off the start of my workday for much longer; it's unacceptable.
creator: beatlekris67

title: Firefox download-manager saves status code 204/404 response body to local download folder
content:
I am not sure whether I can post one issue related with programming, I think it is better to report it bugzilla for FF, but it seems not to be available now According to the below information, I knew FF can work well for the download from WebPage

  • Why isn't it possible to download a file for status code 4XX and 5XX
  • File-not-found HTML downloaded as .exe from members.aol.com

But in FF download manager, the behavior is different, when cancelling the download, and remove it from server side, and then select retry, it still downloads the response body as a binary file, here is the reproduce steps:

1. Preparing a big zip file, for example, photos.zip, 20MB 2. Put it to http server side, and write a simple download web page Download a zip file 3. Download it with FF, and then cancel it before the download is finished 4. Remove this file from http server 5. In FF download manager, select the cancel download, and retry or restore the download 6. It will download the below response body, and save the below 404 page as "photos.zip" "http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/strict.dtd">

<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html;charset=utf-8"> <title>Error response</title>

Error response

Error code: 404

Message: File not found.

Error code explanation: HTTPStatus.NOT_FOUND - Nothing matches the given URI.

It is very confused, and let end-user misunderstand that the original file is already downloaded successfully. I also try to modify server response content-type to "application/octet-stream", content-length to "0" or "-1", all does not work even save a photos.zip with zero size. In the download manager of other browsers, for example, Chrome, it does not save anything to local download folder if the status code is 204/4xx/5xx. So, my question is: How to let FF not to save anything to local download folder for the download URL which response with 204/4XX/5XX, keep the same behavior with download from webpage?
creator: wangf1978

title: Slow speed using latest Firefox version on PC
content:
Hello everyone,

I'm currently running into some speed issues with Firefox on my laptop. I run Windows 10 on my HP Pavillion Notebook, 64 bit, 8GB RAM. It has been very slow to load all pages for the past 2 days, despite no real change in routine.

My internet connection is fine however, and other browsers such as Chrome run very fast on my PC. I have my Firefox updated to the latest version, I haven't installed any new add-ons in a long time. Just gave my current ones a look and all seem fine. Can also run Firefox fine on phone, so the speed issue is strictly for Firefox on PC. I've restarted my laptop, router, run troubleshooting, and nothing is showing up.

Should I wait this out and see if it clears up on it's own? If so, for how long? And if not, what should I do to fix this? Please let me know if you have any new suggestions, thank you.
creator: bobbyjutton

title: Firefox keeps crashing upon startup (in safe mode; after reinstallation)
content:
Firefox often crashes when I start it. I have tried reinstalling firefox clean (also removing the profile folder). The crashes also happen in troubleshooting mode. After several reopening/crashes, Firefox may be successfully opened (even in normal mode).

It's the latest Firefox. I am on Windows 11 22H2. NVidia driver also just updated to latest.

Some submitted crash reports: bp-b1d488c1-66a3-4068-9b07-6f5490221213 & bp-b872a4e0-28d2-4491-889c-0e65e0221213

Cheers
